qc.notes: 8 poses met the core set (front, left_45, right_45, chin_up, chin_down, nose_close, ≥1 cheek_close, ≥1 under_eye_close). Outdoor indirect daylight; a couple of close-ups are slightly soft.

skin_type.label: combination
skin_type.rationale: T-zone shows more shine and visible pores while outer cheeks/jaw are calmer with smaller pores.

skin_tone_fitzpatrick.label: IV
skin_tone_fitzpatrick.note: Estimated from medium-tan appearance in indirect daylight; exact tone can vary with lighting.

skin_age_range.rationale: Mild fine lines with more emphasis on texture, pores, and mottled pigmentation; no deep folds. Outdoor lighting and soft focus in a few close-ups reduce certainty.

analysis.overview_explanation: Moderate mottled pigmentation across the cheeks and temples is the main visual driver, followed by T-zone pore visibility and a grainy cheek texture. Fine lines are mild, redness is localized, and active blemishes are limited. Under-eye darkening is moderate and symmetric.

pores.rationale_plain: Visible and clustered pores on the nose with spread to the medial cheeks; forehead shows smaller pores. Density and apparent size are greater in the T-zone.
possible_causes: Higher oil production in the T-zone keeps pores more visible.
Urban heat and pollution can increase congestion and pore prominence.
Chronic micro-comedones can make pores look larger.

identified_subtypes.explanation: Pores are most obvious on the nose/medial cheeks/forehead compared with the outer face.
care_education: Gentle daily cleansing and consistent sunscreen.
Introduce a leave-on BHA 1–2% a few evenings per week; avoid harsh scrubs.

identified_subtypes.explanation: Larger pore openings are visible in good lighting on the nose and medial cheeks.
likely_causes: Oil and debris repeatedly stretching openings.
care_education: Prioritize chemical exfoliation and UV protection.
Stay consistent—changes are gradual over weeks.

identified_subtypes.explanation: Grainy cheek texture and blackhead cues suggest easy congestion.
care_education: Patch-test new actives and increase slowly.
Balance exfoliation with barrier support using a light gel moisturizer.

citations.title: AI grading of enlarged pores (Dermatol Ther, 2024)

pores.uncertainty_notes: Close-ups are slightly soft which can reduce micro-detail.

wrinkles.rationale_plain: Fine lines at rest are subtle on forehead and peri-orbital regions; no deep folds are visible.

identified_subtypes.explanation: Short, faint lines seen at rest.
care_education: Daily sunscreen; consider a gentle retinoid at night if tolerated.
Regular moisturizer use to support barrier and plump fine lines.

identified_subtypes.explanation: Lines expected with expression though not strongly present at rest.
likely_causes: Sun exposure can make dynamic lines persist.
care_education: Sun protection plus night retinoid and peptides can improve appearance.
If deeper lines develop, discuss options with a clinician.

pigmentation.rationale_plain: Symmetric, mottled tan-brown macules are most visible on the cheeks and temples, with milder involvement on forehead and upper lip.
possible_causes: Post-blemish marks after acne or irritation.

identified_subtypes.explanation: Patchy, symmetric cheek/temple emphasis without sharp borders.
care_education: Daily broad-spectrum SPF 50; re-apply when outdoors.
Consider gentle brighteners (azelaic acid, niacinamide, arbutin derivatives); seek clinician guidance if long-standing.

identified_subtypes.explanation: Small darker spots that track prior blemishes on cheeks/chin.
care_education: Sun protection and patience—PIH often fades over months.
Use gentle spot brighteners; avoid picking.

pigmentation.uncertainty_notes: Color can look lighter/darker depending on brightness and camera exposure.

redness.rationale_plain: Faint localized redness at nostrils and medial cheeks; not diffuse, no clear vessels seen.

identified_subtypes.explanation: Redness is discrete around the alae/central cheeks rather than widespread.
care_education: Keep exfoliation gentle; use barrier-supporting moisturizer.
Apply sunscreen daily; monitor triggers.

identified_subtypes.explanation: Mild central tendency without confluent spread.
care_education: Simplify routine if stinging occurs.
If redness persists/worsens with burning, consult a clinician.

redness.uncertainty_notes: Outdoor warmth may transiently increase redness.

texture.rationale_plain: Cheeks show a grainy, uneven micro-relief; forehead is smoother. Texture correlates with pore prominence and comedonal cues.

identified_subtypes.explanation: Numerous tiny bumps and fine roughness are visible on cheek close-ups.
care_education: Introduce BHA 1–2% or PHA 2–4×/week as tolerated.
Moisturize to maintain barrier; avoid harsh scrubs.

identified_subtypes.explanation: Cheek texture is coarser than forehead/jaw.
likely_causes: T-zone oil spread to medial cheeks.
care_education: Gentle cleanser and steady sunscreen.
Layer actives slowly to avoid irritation.

texture.uncertainty_notes: One cheek close-up is slightly soft, which can smooth fine grain.

acne.rationale_plain: A few small cheek/chin lesions with comedonal cues; no nodules or cysts seen. Post-blemish marks are more noticeable than active lesions.

identified_subtypes.explanation: Open comedone cues around nose/medial cheeks.
likely_causes: Oil and oxidation at pore openings.
care_education: Use leave-on BHA and non-comedogenic sunscreen.
Avoid picking; cleanse gently after heavy sweat.

identified_subtypes.explanation: Tiny closed bumps visible on cheeks/chin.
care_education: Gradual exfoliation; keep routines simple to limit irritation.
Spot-treat as needed; seek clinician help if lesions become painful.

identified_subtypes.explanation: A few small red bumps on cheeks/chin.
care_education: Spot care with anti-acne actives.
If scarring/pain develops, consult a clinician.

acne.uncertainty_notes: Macro detail is adequate but very tiny lesions may be undercounted.

under_eye.rationale_plain: Both under-eyes show moderate darkening with mild tear-trough shadow; puffiness is not prominent.
possible_causes: Sun exposure and lifestyle factors like sleep/stress.

identified_subtypes.explanation: Browner tone under the lids relative to the adjacent cheek.
care_education: Apply sunscreen up to the orbital bone; consider tinted mineral sunscreen.
Introduce gentle brighteners if tolerated; avoid rubbing.

identified_subtypes.explanation: Mild medial trough casting a shadow.
likely_causes: Normal anatomy and soft tissue contours.
care_education: Hydration and light occlusive at night.
Discuss cosmetic options with a clinician if this is a key concern.

under_eye.uncertainty_notes: Single under-eye close-up; slight softness may hide fine vessels.

region_summaries.summary_plain: Smooth with smaller pores and minimal lines; mild shine only.
Calm skin and small pores; no obvious etched lines.
Moderate darkening medially with mild fine lines.
Moderate darkening medially; similar to left with mild lines.
Most mottled pigmentation and grainy texture here; pores visible medially.
Matches left cheek with slightly more pore/texture prominence.
Highest pore visibility and slight alar redness.
A few tiny bumps and faint marks; mild unevenness.
Calmer skin with fewer pores and minimal redness.
Similar to left jaw; minimal issues.

limitations: A couple of close-ups are slightly soft which may under-represent micro-detail.
No expression series to grade dynamic lines.
